definition: to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
(negative prefix)/not/no
ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale

sentences.english: The smart and charming women are self-glorification.
sentences.chinese: 聰明又漂亮的女孩自命不凡。

sentences.english: Sometimes I even quarrel with them and do something which displeases them.
sentences.chinese: 有時我甚至與他們爭吵和做一些自命不凡。

sentences.english: We like seeing Mickey teaching the snootier characters some gritty life lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我們喜歡看見米奇教訓那些自命不凡的角色。

sentences.english: A portentous soufflé that never truly rises.
sentences.chinese: 一部自命不凡的雜湊，不可能真正成功。

sentences.english: Kennedy handled the firestorm of outrage with self-defeating smugness.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪用自我拆臺的自命不凡來對付憤怒的烈火。

sentences.english: Hotshot Eddie needed money to buy a new guitar.
sentences.chinese: 自命不凡的埃迪需要錢買把新吉他。

sentences.english: Her conceit deluded her into believing she was important.
sentences.chinese: 她的自負誘使她相信是自命不凡的。

sentences.english: A snobby person, Dr. Lee thinks some patients ignorant and stupid.
sentences.chinese: 自命不凡的李醫師，覺得一些病人無知和愚蠢。

sentences.english: He is talented , and venturesome, and resolute.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個有才華但自命不凡的作家。

sentences.english: Im tired of his holier than thou attitude toward me .
sentences.chinese: 我厭倦了他在我面前自命不凡的態度。

sentences.english: This kind of obscurity is not only pretensions; it is short-sighted .
sentences.chinese: 這種含糊其詞不僅顯得自命不凡，而且缺乏遠見。

sentences.english: She was so self-conceited that she was averse to all advice from others.
sentences.chinese: 她是如此自命不凡，以致聽不得別人的任何忠告。

definition: to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
arrogant and conceited
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to think of oneself as terrific (idiom); arrogant
arrogance/proud of sth
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
to be cynical/to be embittered
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
arrogant
to think highly of oneself
to view oneself
megalomania/egomania/delusions of grandeur
